What is meant by ‘existence’? Certainly ‘Consciousness’ is. No theory or belief is required to attest this fact. As for everything else… it is plain that all ‘objects’ appear in Consciousness as an instantaneous collection of sensations (colours, feelings, odours, flavours and sounds) that appear as ‘my body’ and ‘my feelings’ and ‘my thoughts’ and ‘my surroundings’ (including specific ‘things and events’), as specific ideas are associated with each part of the sensory pattern as it arises. The patterns themselves have no ‘parts’. It is idea alone that makes the distinctions between ‘this’ and ‘that’. Consciousness is Sensing-sensations and Knowing-ideas and the Power to manifest sensations into patterns that accord with the ideas, to create the appearance of an ‘external world’… as in a dream. These are all meaningless words. Any attempt to define them is to miss the ‘pointing’. Yet, to recognise their import is not difficult. Simply become ‘aware of awareness’. Notice this Seeing and Hearing and Feeling and Smelling and Tasting and Knowing… This is it :) If there is doubt the apparent world is an illusion… check it out. Notice that ‘things’ thought of as having a fixed size, position and shape constantly appear to change in every respect. One thing known to be larger than another at times appears to be smaller than it. Lines that are known to be parallel appear to converge. This can only ‘be’ if the appearance is an illusion, and not the ‘thing itself’. In fact all things ‘exist’ in reality only as ideas. Every idea takes its meaning from all other ideas. No idea can ever change, for if it did, it would be a different idea and not the idea it is. No idea can ‘exist’ apart from it being Known. Knowing all ideas as One, ever unchanged is called Omniscience. How could Consciousness be ‘All-Knowing’ and not know it? Notice that there is no awareness of any idea… until it is imaged by sensations. So the word ‘elephant’ suddenly appears. Instantly, the meaning is known. Notice however, that until the word appeared there was no awareness of knowing or not knowing the idea represented by the word. Only as an idea is represented by some sensory symbol is there any awareness of knowing it. This could be the image of the beast itself, the the sound of it trumpeting, etc. It could be a ‘subtle image’ that represents a ‘thought’ or ‘imagined creature’. But without any image at all, how could there be ‘awareness’? The sensory symbols representing any apparent object are not the idea that is immediately associated with them. Which is to say, the images are not the cause of the idea. It is the idea that gives the images their meaning. This is evidenced when the word ‘elephant’ is read from the perspective of a non-English speaker; the word in that case appears as meaningless… because no idea is associated with it. So it may be said that Consciousness exists… ever unchanged. Though ‘what’ it is, or ‘how’ it came to be remains an eternal mystery. Don’t believe it… all ‘belief’ is based on ‘ideas’… and this reality is not a ‘concept’. Try to fathom its depths… impossible :)
